visualizer.display
Class OptimizingLayouts

java.lang.Object
  visualizer.display.OptimizingLayouts

public class OptimizingLayouts
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains static layout algorithms similar to the Layouts class. But OptimizingLayouts contains methods that try to arrange objects using optimization algorithms.

Author:
Rene Wegener

Constructor Summary
OptimizingLayouts()

static void createJigsawLayout(java.util.ArrayList<prefuse.visual.VisualItem> v, int startX, int startY, int itemWidth, int itemHeight, GlyphTable gt)
          create an layout that puts all VisualItems on a grid; similar items are tried to be put close together;

          create an layout that places all VisualItems on the screen, trying to keep similar items close together
static void createOrderedTableLayout(java.util.ArrayList<prefuse.visual.VisualItem> v, int startX, int startY, int itemWidth, int itemHeight, GlyphTable gt)
          create a table that puts items with high values to the top; if the data is 2D than a clustering is performed to arrange similar items together; this is not implemented for 3D data yet

OptimizingLayouts

public OptimizingLayouts()
Method Detail

createOrderedTableLayout

public static void createOrderedTableLayout(java.util.ArrayList<prefuse.visual.VisualItem> v,
                                            int startX,
                                            int startY,
                                            int itemWidth,
                                            int itemHeight,
                                            GlyphTable gt)
create a table that puts items with high values to the top; if the data is 2D than a clustering is performed to arrange similar items together; this is not implemented for 3D data yet

Parameters:
v - an ArrayList containing all VisualItems to arrange; if the data structure is 3D then the items are supposed to be ordered row by row in the ArrayList
startX - x-coordinate at which to start the layout
startY - y-coordinate at which to start the layout
itemWidth - width of the VisualItems
itemHeight - height of the VisualItems
gt - GlyphTable that holds the VisualItems

createJigsawLayout

public static void createJigsawLayout(java.util.ArrayList<prefuse.visual.VisualItem> v,
                                      int startX,
                                      int startY,
                                      int itemWidth,
                                      int itemHeight,
                                      GlyphTable gt)
create an layout that puts all VisualItems on a grid; similar items are tried to be put close together;

Parameters:
v - an ArrayList containing all VisualItems to arrange
startX - x-coordinate at which to start the layout
startY - y-coordinate at which to start the layout
itemWidth - width of the VisualItems
itemHeight - height of the VisualItems
gt - GlyphTable that holds the VisualItems

                                   int startX,
                                   int startY,
                                   int itemWidth,

                                   GlyphTable gt)
create an layout that places all VisualItems on the screen, trying to keep similar items close together

Parameters:
v - an ArrayList containing all VisualItems to arrange
startX - x-coordinate at which to start the layout
startY - y-coordinate at which to start the layout
itemWidth - width of the VisualItems
itemHeight - height of the VisualItems
gt - GlyphTable that holds the VisualItems
